body_html:
Thank you gunan, That is exactly how I ran the test:
>>python basic_gpu_test.py
and that is how I got the error message described in the issue. No big deal..I commented the line out. and..commented out every line that lead to similar error. I was only interested in checking if my gpu is working at all. The test (with few lines commented out) did tell me it was working alright. I felt obliged to let wonderful people at google that asinh (and 4 other functions) is not being supported by tensor 1.2.1 Feel free to ignore it Bye for now, Shirish
…

body_text:
Thank you gunan,

That is exactly how I ran the test:
>>python basic_gpu_test.py
and that is how I got the error message described in the issue.

No big deal..I commented the line out. and..commented out every line that lead to similar error.


I was only interested in checking if my gpu is working at all. The test (with few lines commented out) did tell me it was working alright.


I felt obliged to let wonderful people at google that asinh (and 4 other functions) is not being supported by tensor 1.2.1


Feel free to ignore it


Bye for now,
Shirish
…

To: tensorflow/tensorflow
Cc: Shirish (Sam) Ranade; Author
Subject: Re: [tensorflow/tensorflow] Looks like a bug tensorflow 1.2.1 with gpu error during basic_gpu_test (#11817)


While the recommended way is to use bazel, most of our tests "should" run without bazel, just by running python <filename>.
For the equivalent of what we are running on our CI for windows, you may check this script:

body:
Thank you gunan,

That is exactly how I ran the test:


>>>python basic_gpu_test.py


and that is how I got the error message described in the issue.

No big deal..I commented the line out. and..commented out every line that lead to similar error.


I was only interested in checking if my gpu is working at all. The test (with few lines commented out) did tell me it was working alright.


I felt obliged to let wonderful people at google that asinh (and 4 other functions) is not being supported by tensor 1.2.1


Feel free to ignore it


Bye for now,
Shirish
